rule: The chosen category for classification must not clearly represent or be consistent with the core subject matter of the input text as it fits within the provided category definitions.
input: Global art fair showcases emerging talents from Latin America
complianceText:
The chatbot output is a single word "World", which suggests that it classified the input text into one of the specified categories mentioned in the description: World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech. The description states that the chatbot's task is to classify a news article into one of these categories, and "World" is indeed one of the valid categories. There is no information required from the input text itself to determine compliance, and since the output fits within the expected categories, it meets the requirement.

No violation.
OK
